---
slug: /233
title: "This Week In React #233: RSC, Next.js, Compiler, Unhead, Shadcn, Relay, Mantine | Expo, WebGPU, Skia, Apple fees, Reanimated, Fragment Refs | Node.js, TS, Prisma, Deno, GSAP"
authors: [slorber]
date: 05-07-2025
---
Hi everyone!
This week we don't have one, but 2 interesting blog posts from Dan Abramov, and various React releases.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, nous avons non pas un, mais deux articles de blog int√©ressants de Dan Abramov, ainsi que diverses versions de React.
translations.en: Cette semaine, nous n'en avons pas un mais deux articles de blog int√©ressants de Dan Abramov, ainsi que diverses versions de React.

segments.source_content: I found the mobile news particularly interesting, with Expo 53, Skia Graphite, Reanimated Shared Elements Transitions, and the Apple fees court injunction.

translations.fr: J'ai trouv√© les nouvelles mobiles particuli√®rement int√©ressantes, avec Expo 53, Skia Graphite, les transitions d'√©l√©ments partag√©s de Reanimated et l'injonction judiciaire sur les frais d'Apple.
translations.en: J'ai trouv√© les nouvelles mobiles particuli√®rement int√©ressantes, avec Expo 53, Skia Graphite, les transitions d'√©l√©ments partag√©s de Reanimated et l'injonction judiciaire sur les frais d'Apple.

segments.source_content: My fellows at ui.dev are also launching the final content of their [react.gg](https://react.gg/?ref=twir) course (30% off now), designed to teach you all the brand-new React 19 concepts from first principles. I got access to review it and can assure you that it's a really playful way to learn React, full of interactive examples, visualizations and pragmatic quizzes.

translations.fr: Mes coll√®gues chez ui.dev lancent √©galement le contenu final de leur cours [react.gg](https://react.gg/?ref=twir) (30% de r√©duction actuellement), con√ßu pour vous enseigner tous les nouveaux concepts de React 19 √† partir des principes fondamentaux. J'ai eu acc√®s pour le relire et peux vous assurer que c'est une mani√®re ludique d'apprendre React, remplie d'exemples interactifs, de visualisations et de quiz pragmatiques.
translations.en: Mes coll√®gues de ui.dev lancent √©galement le contenu final de leur cours [react.gg](https://react.gg/?ref=twir) (30% de r√©duction actuellement), con√ßu pour vous enseigner tous les nouveaux concepts de React 19 √† partir des premiers principes. J'ai pu le consulter en avant-premi√®re et peux vous assurer que c'est une m√©thode vraiment ludique pour apprendre React, pleine d'exemples interactifs, de visualisations et de quiz pragmatiques.

segments.source_content: ## ‚öõÔ∏è React {#react}

- üí∏ [Product for Engineers - What engineers get wrong about communication](https://go.posthog.com/twir-may7)
- üëÄ [Next.js Docs \- New `runAfterProductionCompile` lifecycle hook](https://nextjs.org/docs/architecture/nextjs-compiler#runafterproductioncompile): Upcoming (unreleased) feature already documented.
- üí¨ [React Compiler oxc plugin](https://github.com/oxc-project/oxc/issues/10048): Interesting discussions between the React Compiler team and the oxc team to integrate the compiler as an oxc plugin for upcoming usage with Vite and Oxc/Rolldown. The React team suggests making it happen in 2 steps (make it work, then make it fast).
- üßµ [shadcn introducing the registry MCP \- One command to make any component registry mcp-compatible.](https://threadreaderapp.com/thread/1917597228513853603.html)
- üìú [Functional HTML](https://overreacted.io/functional-html/): Dan gradually reinvents the HTML he wants from first principles, leading to an RSC implementation.
- üìú [RSC for Astro Developers](https://overreacted.io/rsc-for-astro-developers/): RSC and Astro have 2 remarkably similar mental models, but Dan exposes some interesting subtle differences. RSCs may feel less intuitive at first, but they also solve some of Astro‚Äôs limitations.
- üìú [The future of AI interaction: Beyond just text](https://www.epicai.pro/the-future-of-ai-interaction-beyond-just-text-w22ps): Kent argues that MCPs could have a role to play in implementing generative UIs with React Server Components. He wants the protocol to allow richer return types like html and RSC payloads.
- üìú [Frontends are hard](https://sst.dev/blog/frontends-are-hard): The devs at SST reflect on the challenges of self-hosting modern meta-frameworks, including React ones, that led them to start the OpenNext initiative.
- üìú [Add a Color Scheme Toggle in React Router](https://sergiodxa.com/tutorials/add-a-color-scheme-toggle-in-react-router): This method avoids FOUC with a cookie instead of inlined JS.
- üìú [Robust Data Fetching Architecture For Complex React/Next.js Apps](https://www.trevorlasn.com/blog/fetching-data-for-complex-next-and-react-apps): Suggests using 3 layers: Server Components, React Query, and Optimistic Updates.
- üìú [Server Components Give You Optionality](https://saewitz.com/server-components-give-you-optionality): They give flexibility to choose in which environments your components run in (Server, Server+Client, or Client) and when.
- üìú [How We Fell Out of Love with Next.js and Back in Love with Ruby on Rails & Inertia.js](https://hardcover.app/blog/part-1-how-we-fell-out-of-love-with-next-js-and-back-in-love-with-ruby-on-rails-inertia-js)
- üìú [Why Kleinanzeigen.de Picked Astro Over Next.js](https://d13z.dev/blog/07-why-kleinanzeigen-picked-astro-over-nextjs/)
- üìú [When You Might Need to Override the Defaults in TanStack Query](https://www.kxlaa.com/articles/when-you-might-need-to-override-the-defaults-in-tanstack-query)
- üí∏ [React.gg - The interactive way to master modern React, including new v19 modules - 30% off during launch week](https://react.gg/?ref=twir)
- üì¶ [Unhead 2.0 \- The full stack \<head\> package for any framework](https://unhead.unjs.io/v2): This framework-agnostic package from the UnJS ecosystem now includes React bindings. This could be a great drop-in alternative to `react-helmet` with React 19 support if the new built-in APIs are not good enough for you (see [my comment here](https://github.com/staylor/react-helmet-async/issues/239#issuecomment-2565685131)).
- üì¶ [Blade \- Build instant web apps with React](https://github.com/ronin-co/blade): A new opinionated React meta-framework with Server Components support, that purposefully doesn‚Äôt comply with the RSC spec.
- üì¶ [Relay 19.0 \- `@alias` required on conditional fragments, support React 19](https://relay.dev/blog/2025/04/02/relay-19/)
- üì¶ [Mantine 8.0 \- Updated dates package, new TimePicker, Heatmap, CodeHighlight components, nested menus and more](https://mantine.dev/changelog/8-0-0/)
- üì¶ [React Error Boundary 6.0 \- ESM-only](https://github.com/bvaughn/react-error-boundary/releases/tag/6.0.0)
- üì¶ [React Admin 5.8 \- InPlaceEditor, DataTable, AuthLayout, MUI v7, CSS vars, theming](https://github.com/marmelab/react-admin/releases/tag/v5.8.0)
- üì¶ [Unverceled Next.js \- A Next.js 15 Starter Kit Deployed to Cloudflare using OpenNext](https://github.com/ixahmedxi/unverceled-nextjs)
- üì¶ [Radix UI \- New unstable PasswordToggleField and Checkbox parts](https://www.radix-ui.com/primitives/docs/overview/releases#may-5-2025)
- üì¶ [React Router DevTools 5.0 \- Complete overhaul of the routes tab](https://github.com/forge-42/react-router-devtools/releases/tag/v5.0.0)
- üì¶ [MUI 7.1 \- Support for Tailwind CSS 4](https://github.com/mui/material-ui/releases/tag/v7.1.0)
- üé• [Jack Herrington \- React's New Activity Component: Huge Performance Win\!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gRKVL5w-2Lc)
- üé• [Fireship \- The growing divide among React developers‚Ä¶](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lLJbHHeFSsE)
- üéôÔ∏è [Front-end Fire 93 \- React Activity, Storybook 9 Beta, and AI as a Collaborator](https://front-end-fire.com/episodes/93/)

segments.source_content: ## üì± React-Native {#react-native}
[![Expo SDK 53](/emails/issues/233/expo53.jpg)](https://expo.dev/changelog/sdk-53)
**[Expo SDK 53](https://expo.dev/changelog/sdk-53)**
This is quite an impressive Expo release, with highlights:

translations.fr: Il s'agit d'une version assez impressionnante d'Expo, avec comme points forts :
translations.en: C'est une version d'Expo assez impressionnante, avec comme points forts :

segments.source_content:
- Upgrades to React Native 0.79, React 19, and RNW 0.20
- Turns the New Arch on by default
- Edge-to-edge on Android is enabled by default
- New [Expo BackgroundTask](https://expo.dev/blog/goodbye-background-fetch-hello-expo-background-task), a modern, reliable, power-efficient, and future-proof way to run background tasks using Android `WorkManager` and iOS `BGTaskScheduler` system APIs
- New [Expo Maps](https://expo.dev/blog/introducing-expo-maps-a-modern-maps-api-for-expo-developers) (alpha) built on Expo Modules API, using SwiftUI and Jetpack Compose, expose platform default Apple Maps and Google Maps components.
- Metro `package.json#exports` resolution enabled by default
- Deploy development builds to TestFlight with `npx testflight`
- Improve Android build times up to 25% with prebuilt Expo Modules
- And way more\!

translations.fr:
- Mises √† niveau vers React Native 0.79, React 19 et RNW 0.20
- Active la Nouvelle Architecture par d√©faut
- Le mode Edge-to-edge sur Android est activ√© par d√©faut
- Nouveau [Expo BackgroundTask](https://expo.dev/blog/goodbye-background-fetch-hello-expo-background-task), une m√©thode moderne, fiable, √©conome en √©nergie et p√©renne pour ex√©cuter des t√¢ches en arri√®re-plan utilisant les API syst√®me `WorkManager` d'Android et `BGTaskScheduler` d'iOS
- Nouveau [Expo Maps](https://expo.dev/blog/introducing-expo-maps-a-modern-maps-api-for-expo-developers) (alpha) construit sur l'API Expo Modules, utilisant SwiftUI et Jetpack Compose, exposant les composants par d√©faut des plateformes Apple Maps et Google Maps.
- R√©solution Metro `package.json#exports` activ√©e par d√©faut
- D√©ployez les builds de d√©veloppement sur TestFlight avec `npx testflight`
- R√©duisez les temps de build Android jusqu'√† 25% avec les modules Expo pr√©compil√©s
- Et bien plus encore !
translations.en:
- Mises √† niveau vers React Native 0.79, React 19 et RNW 0.20
- Activation par d√©faut de la Nouvelle Architecture
- Mode Edge-to-edge activ√© par d√©faut sur Android
- Nouveau [Expo BackgroundTask](https://expo.dev/blog/goodbye-background-fetch-hello-expo-background-task), une m√©thode moderne, fiable, √©conome en √©nergie et p√©renne pour ex√©cuter des t√¢ches en arri√®re-plan utilisant les API syst√®me `WorkManager` d'Android et `BGTaskScheduler` d'iOS
- Nouveau [Expo Maps](https://expo.dev/blog/introducing-expo-maps-a-modern-maps-api-for-expo-developers) (alpha) construit sur l'API Expo Modules, utilisant SwiftUI et Jetpack Compose, exposant les composants par d√©faut Apple Maps et Google Maps
- R√©solution `package.json#exports` de Metro activ√©e par d√©faut
- D√©ploiement des builds de d√©veloppement sur TestFlight avec `npx testflight`
- R√©duction des temps de build Android jusqu'√† 25% avec les Expo Modules pr√©compil√©s
- Et bien plus encore !

segments.source_content: See also the [Expo Router v5](https://expo.dev/blog/expo-router-v5) related release with its own highlights:

translations.fr: Voir aussi la sortie associ√©e [Expo Router v5](https://expo.dev/blog/expo-router-v5) avec ses propres points forts :
translations.en: Voir aussi la version associ√©e [Expo Router v5](https://expo.dev/blog/expo-router-v5) avec ses propres points forts :

segments.source_content:
- Requires React 19 / Expo 53
- Improves DX, error screen and logging, leverages React owner stacks
- Deploy versioned API Routes in production with EAS Hosting
- React Server Functions in beta
- Protected routes

translations.fr:
- N√©cessite React 19 / Expo 53
- Am√©liore l'exp√©rience d√©veloppeur (DX), l'√©cran d'erreur et la journalisation, tire parti des piles propri√©taires de React
- D√©ployez des routes API versionn√©es en production avec EAS Hosting
- React Server Functions en b√™ta
- Routes prot√©g√©es
translations.en:
- N√©cessite React 19 / Expo 53
- Am√©liore la DX (exp√©rience d√©veloppeur), l'√©cran d'erreur et la journalisation, exploite les piles propri√©taires de React
- D√©ploiement de routes API versionn√©es en production avec EAS Hosting
- React Server Functions en version b√™ta
- Routes prot√©g√©es

segments.source_content: [![Game On - Bringing WebGPU to React Native](/emails/issues/233/skia.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t9t-VXwIc4I)
**[üé• Game On \- Bringing WebGPU to React Native](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t9t-VXwIc4I)**

translations.fr: **[üé• Game On \- Apport de WebGPU √† React Native](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t9t-VXwIc4I)**
translations.en: **[üé• Game On \- Apport de WebGPU √† React Native](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t9t-VXwIc4I)**

segments.source_content: In a 37-minute video packed with exciting announcements, William Candillon and guests gave us a glimpse into the future of drawing and animation. Supported by Shopify, he‚Äôs bringing modern WebGPU support (Vulkan and Metal) to React Native.

translations.fr: Dans une vid√©o de 37 minutes remplie d'annonces passionnantes, William Candillon et ses invit√©s nous ont offert un aper√ßu du futur du dessin et de l'animation. Soutenu par Shopify, il apporte le support moderne de WebGPU (Vulkan et Metal) √† React Native.
translations.en: Dans une vid√©o de 37 minutes remplie d'annonces passionnantes, William Candillon et ses invit√©s nous ont offert un aper√ßu du futur du dessin et de l'animation. Soutenu par Shopify, il apporte la prise en charge moderne de WebGPU (Vulkan et Metal) √† React Native.

segments.source_content: By aligning to the web APIs, it's possible to copy/paste existing web examples (including Three.js) and make them work on all platforms. It also enables general-purpose use of the GPU (AI, TensorFlow.js), which you may achieve more easily thanks to a convenient low-level TypeGPU library.

translations.fr: En s'alignant sur les APIs web, il est possible de copier/coller des exemples web existants (y compris Three.js) et de les faire fonctionner sur toutes les plateformes. Cela permet √©galement une utilisation g√©n√©rale du GPU (IA, TensorFlow.js), r√©alisable plus facilement gr√¢ce √† une biblioth√®que bas niveau pratique : TypeGPU.
translations.en: En s'alignant sur les API web, il devient possible de copier-coller des exemples web existants (y compris Three.js) et de les faire fonctionner sur toutes les plateformes. Cela permet √©galement une utilisation polyvalente du GPU (IA, TensorFlow.js), r√©alisable plus facilement gr√¢ce √† une biblioth√®que bas niveau pratique TypeGPU.

segments.source_content: All this work was needed to create a new experimental Skia Graphite backend based on WebGPU. It enables composing and interleaving 2D/3D experiences in a performant way, like on the web, but across all platforms, with full Reanimated integration. Along the way, Skia doesn‚Äôt come with any new feature, but has significantly improved performance, reduced, crashes, and supports 3 new platforms: tvOS, macOS and Node. Keep massaging that octopus William\!

translations.fr: Tout ce travail √©tait n√©cessaire pour cr√©er un nouveau backend exp√©rimental Skia Graphite bas√© sur WebGPU. Il permet de composer et d'entrelacer des exp√©riences 2D/3D de mani√®re performante, comme sur le web, mais sur toutes les plateformes, avec une int√©gration compl√®te de Reanimated. Au passage, Skia n'apporte pas de nouvelle fonctionnalit√©, mais a consid√©rablement am√©lior√© les performances, r√©duit les plantages, et prend en charge 3 nouvelles plateformes : tvOS, macOS et Node. Continue de masser cette pieuvre William !
translations.en: Ces travaux √©taient n√©cessaires pour cr√©er un nouveau backend exp√©rimental Skia Graphite bas√© sur WebGPU. Il permet de composer et d'entrelacer des exp√©riences 2D/3D de mani√®re performante, comme sur le web, mais sur toutes les plateformes, avec une int√©gration compl√®te de Reanimated. Skia n'introduit aucune nouvelle fonctionnalit√©, mais am√©liore significativement les performances, r√©duit les plantages, et prend en charge 3 nouvelles plateformes : tvOS, macOS et Node. Continue de masser cette pieuvre William !

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [React Universe Conf 2025 adds new speakers: V. Morozov & K. Hosany (Microsoft), K. Hansen (MongoDB), Z. Chapple (Zephyr Cloud) and more.](https://www.reactuniverseconf.com/?utm_campaign=7310698-RUC%202025&utm_source=TWIR&utm_content=New%20Speakers)
- ‚öñÔ∏è [Epic Games Wins Major Victory as Apple is Ordered to Comply With App Store Anti-Steering Injunction](https://www.macrumors.com/2025/04/30/apple-app-store-anti-steering-injunction-violation/): A court judged that Apple purposefully did not comply with a former injunction to let apps use alternative payment methods and bypass the 30% fee on in-app purchases. ‚ÄúFor this Court, there is no second bite at the apple‚Äù. A major event for the mobile industry that enables Fortnite to return, the Kindle app to finally sell e-books directly, and new business models. Check [Expo](https://expo.dev/blog/mobile-app-payment-processing-best-practices) and [Vercel](https://vercel.com/blog/ios-developers-can-now-offer-commission-free-payments-on-web) guides and starters to avoid the fee.
- üëÄ [React Core PR \- Add Fragment Refs to Fabric with intersection observer support](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/33056): The recent React Labs post briefly mentioned an upcoming [Fragment Refs](https://react.dev/blog/2025/04/23/react-labs-view-transitions-activity-and-more#fragment-refs) feature. It looks like in the future we‚Äôll be able to use a web-like IntersectionObserver to know when a React fragment enters the screen. Still research/work-in-progress, but exciting new features ahead.
- üëÄ [Reanimated PR \- Shared Elements Transitions on the New Architecture](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-reanimated/pull/7466): Exciting draft PR from Software Mansion that plans to stabilize Shared Elements Transitions for the New Architecture (that enables sharing C++ code between platforms).
- üìú [Sirens, Sagas, and Stack Traces: A React Native Upgrade Odyssey](https://shift.infinite.red/sirens-sagas-and-stack-traces-a-react-native-upgrade-odyssey-52db6beb0aac)
- üî® [Package Checker \- Check for New Architecture compatibility](https://react-native-package-checker.vercel.app/)
- üì¶ [Compose Multiplatform 1.8 \- Compose Multiplatform for iOS Is Stable and Production-Ready](https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2025/05/compose-multiplatform-1-8-0-released-compose-multiplatform-for-ios-is-stable-and-production-ready/): The cross-platform UI toolkit from JetBrains enables code sharing between iOS and Android. Unlike React Native, the iOS (and web) support is based on Skia, not using UIKit native elements.
- üì¶ [Zustand 5.0.4 \+ Jotai 2.12.4](https://github.com/pmndrs/jotai/discussions/3041): Fixing an incompatibility issue with RN 0.79 / Expo 53 / Metro 0.82.
- üì¶ [Nitro Audio Manager \- Nitro module for AVAudioSession/AudioManager APIs](https://github.com/ChristopherGabba/react-native-nitro-audio-manager)
- üì¶ [Expo Build Disk Cache \- A plugin for Expo CLI to improve build time](https://github.com/WookieFPV/expo-build-disk-cache)
- üì¶ [Expo App Template \- Modern, sensible defaults and fast Expo app template](https://github.com/nkzw-tech/expo-app-template)
- üé• [Jamon Holmgren \- How to build a Mac app with React Native for macOS](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0h-owMCfy5s)
- üé• [React Universe Meetup \- 3 new videos from April: Polygen, File-based router, native feel](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZ3MwD-soTTEFaxmATqOTcitPEK5iaz1z)
- üé• [Simon Grimm \- Finally React Native UI Components (Expo 53\)](http://youtube.com/watch?v=kGUrNO8WmCU)
- üéôÔ∏è [React Native Radio 330 \- and Accessibility with Karly Lamm](https://infinite.red/react-native-radio/rnr-330-react-native-and-accessibility-with-karly-lamm)
- üéôÔ∏è [Rocket Ship 67 \- Quitting RN, React Compiler, Legend List & RN Performance](https://share.transistor.fm/s/18111ecc)
## üîÄ Other {#other}

- üëÄ [TypeScript 5.9 Iteration Plan](https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/61648)
- üìñ [Node.js Docs \- Publishing a package](https://nodejs.org/en/learn/modules/publishing-a-package): A new official guide that also covers ESM/CJS subtleties.
- üìú [Converting values to strings in JavaScript has pitfalls](https://2ality.com/2025/04/stringification-javascript.html)
- üìú [Seeking an Answer: Why can‚Äôt HTML alone do includes?](https://frontendmasters.com/blog/seeking-an-answer-why-cant-html-alone-do-includes/)
- üì¶ [Node 24.0](https://nodejs.org/en/blog/release/v24.0.0): The new Node.js version is out and set to become LTS in October, including npm 11, `AsyncLocalStorage` perf improvements, the `URLPattern` API and a major V8 upgrade to v13.6 that unlocks cool new JS APIs such as Explicit Resource Management (`using`) or `RegExp.escape()` (which is now [available everywhere](https://web-platform-dx.github.io/web-features-explorer/features/regexp-escape/)).
- üì¶ [GSAP 3.13 \- JS animations library \- Now 100% free, including all plugins](https://gsap.com/blog/3-13/)
- üì¶ [Deno 2.3 \- Improved deno compile, local npm packages, deno fmt in tagged templates, and more](https://deno.com/blog/v2.3)
- üì¶ [Prisma 6.7 \- ORM without Rust, multi-file schemas](https://github.com/prisma/prisma/releases/tag/6.7.0)
